author: Asdirko
title: Blown Away...
review:
On the whole, this figure looked intriguing when I first saw it, though let's take a closer look! 

The hair peice returns from the old Luke Skywalker figure from Ach-To, and looks wonderful as well as capturing a very nice look. Very nice peice! 

The face is nice as well, displaying the figure with an open mouthed smile and a singing expression. I imagine that it will be useful for other minifigures. 

The body is amazing, with a black jean jacket  and a pink lightning bolt down the centre. The back is even more impressive, with a logo that says "TOUR" as well as a city skyline. Overall, the body is probably the most impressive peice.

His pants are a little bland, they are just pink pants with a small belt buckle pattern on the hip. At first look it would appear that he had plain pants. 

His accessory is outstanding as well, though with a major flaw: the black keys are on the wrong way. Other than that, amazing,  it doesn't really bother me cause the minifigure is fantastic, though it seems a big fumble for Lego. 

Overall, this minifigure is amazing, and my favorite from series 20, it has many new prints and a new piece. Final Verdict: don't miss out on this guy!

author: Odeinoichus
title: Born to Rock!
review:
Set #71027 80s Musician: This smashing keytar playing fool includes a delightfully impressive head of 80s hair metal hair, a great looking jacket print with tons of personality, zippers and the word TOUR on the back, plus a lightning emblem shirt underneath and pink hot pants for the classic 80s style. With a suitably amusing dual-sided face, one side singing his heart out while rocking, the other smiling with the rockin' good looks and the fancy red keytar accessory this Minifigure has stepped right out of the past.

LEGO has done a disservice with this figure, now we need 40s, 50s, 60s, 70s and 90s musicians to join him up on stage for an awesome revival concert. Overall it's a solid offering with some great elements and any fans of this genre/era of music should definitely pick him up. Recommended.
